Reviews.Title: “FAB LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: karen1426
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights 23-26 August. check in went really smooth, pleasant friendly helpful staff. bit disappointed with the room firstly only on the 4th floor (no higher floors available that day) which is a smoking floor and we don't smoke! secondly no view out of window so had to go onto the small balcony to see anything! room ok, bed really comfy, just a wardrobe to put things in, no draws to put anything in, and no mirror in room! bathroom wow that was modern, spacious and clean with complimentary toiletries and a hair dryer! but has the only mirror so if 2 people are getting ready and one is using the bathroom the other has to wait!!!!! on the plus side there is a lap top in the room for you to use free of charge and also there is free wi-fi in the hotel! although busy outside day and night once you close the balcony doors you don't hear any noise. continental breakfast was included in our room rate and had plenty to choose from although the breakfast room could do with a lick of paint in places i.e. the steps and the chipped plates could be removed also light shades looked grubby!!! The hotel itself is in a fab location with plenty of sights within walking distance. do i recommend this hotel yes for location, as for rooms don't expect to much (obviously can only judge on our room) but then your not in Madrid to spend a lot of time in your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Madrid Spain”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Communication when air conditioner went out they were very prompt at getting us in another near by hotel of equal or better value

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomas C
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel earlier this year. I've had the opportunity to travel around the world and stay at many hotels. This hotel really fits in the category of "two ends of the spectrum." On one hand the hotel is located in a great location in close proximity to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor, as well as many other great tourist streets and buildings nearby. On the other hand, the hotel does not meet the expectations of a "4-star" hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful and very nice. Raquel, in particular, was always smiling and very knowledgeable, and was definitely the most professional staff member I encountered at the hotel. She worked above and beyond what you would expect from the front desk, but really they are far overworked, and the hotel doesn´t support their hard work. The manager at the front desk was rude and unpolite, and I question her credentials and education to be in the position she is in. However, despite all Raquel's effort to give us the best experience at the hotel, sadly the hotel itself does not meet up to the expectations of a hotel that is "4-stars." I have a hard time believing this hotel is a 4-star hotel, because management decisions are extremely poor, some of the rooms are extremely small, and the maintenance and upkeep of the hotel is in poor condition (the showers were plugged, the heater didn´t work, the internet hardly ever works, and the beds are super uncomfortable). My first room was so small that I mistaked it for a maintenance closet. Thankfully, Raquel was wonderful and my room changed! Note there is no fitness area, the elevators are extremely small, and there is no bell-boy to help you carry your luggage up the stairs. Also, be prepared for an extremely expensive breakfast. It's much wiser for you to go outside the hotel, around the corner or across the street for breakfast for half the price. It's puzzling that a hotel that claims it is a 4-star hotel can have as many problems as this one does. I would come to expect some of these deficiencies from a 3-star hotel. Although the front desk staff and the location are great, the price you are paying to stay at this hotel is extremely high for the quality of this hotel. It's not a high tech hotel, as their name suggests. Don't be fooled by the beautiful lobby...the rest of the hotel does not meet these same standards. I would recommend this hotel only if you are coming to Madrid for a few days, with very little luggage. However, if you plan to stay more than 2 days, there's other great hotels in the same location for the city, with comparable prices for a better value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy and cosy”
Reviews.Author: MsPeony1
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid for two nights with two friends. We chose this hotel because of it's location and that was superb! Almost everything was in a walking-distance and if not, the nearest metro station is only 100 m away. The hotel is, in my opinion, quite modest to be a four star hotel but anyway it was clean and the staff was very friendly. We had informed the hotel that we would bring two dogs with us and when we went to our room there was a nice bed for dog too! (We didn't bring the dogs after all because our friends took care of them). Our room was on 7th floor with a great view. The room itself was a bit small for three persons but hey, who comes to Madrid to spend their time in a hotel room? Shower was great but unfortunately the drain was half blocked. I read some complaints about non working wi-fi but in our room it worked perfectly. Lap-top's screen was not very good but when we dimmed lights enough we could read it... Maybe not a perfect hotel if you are expecting something exclusive but for few nights in this prize category - fine!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money. Great location”
Reviews.Author: SimplePleasures24
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days on my first trip to Spain. The hotel is within walking distance of major places of interest and one of the stops on the airport bus (which costs only 2 euros and is the best way to get to the city centre from Terminal 4). Hotel is clean and bed was very comfortable. Wifi was free. Walking distance to Starbucks, Plaza del Sol, Gran Via, Turibus stops, Prado Museum, Thyssen, Plaza de los Cibeles...there's a metro stop close by too. Downside is you have to climb stairs to get to reception. If you have a lot of luggage then that's an issue!

Reviews.Title: “Bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, Breakfast was ok, could be a bit more complete Location was perfect, the rooms were dirty, walking around in the room gave black feet, bathroom had a bad smell from the sewer.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: J O
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with friends, had read some of the reviews before going and wasn't too sure what to expect? infact wanted to cancel and re book elsewhere. On arrival, the lobby, which you have to go up some stairs to, isn't too welcoming, but the staff more than make up for it, they are so nice and extremely helpfull, nothing was too much of a problem, the rooms are small, but clean, Our friends asked to move rooms as theirs only had one window and was quite dark, they did get another room and it was fine. the breakfast is very continental, but great, more than adequate and on par with other hotels that we have stayed at. We wouldn't say it was the 4*'s that it's been sold at, more like 3* Very central to all locations, ideal! Great shower!!! The girls at reception were fantastic in recomending local places to eat. TV channels only in Spanish, at least a news channel in English would be good? maybe thats something the can work on. Overall, a good, clean place to stay for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this place... Awfull... Dirty...Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ax1999
Reviews.Content: I could write 3 pages in between : the bad service (attitude of the staff, poor education, not even good morning...) the poor quality of the rooms equipment, it is supposed to be a "high tech hhotel", they are 8 channels in spanish and 2 in german, the rest of the world of course does not exist, the hallways are so dirty, my room was incredibly dirty, hair in the towel (not mine) dusty shelving, paper under the bed, sheets, mirors... all is bad... AND you can not sleep !!!! It is soooooooooooo noisy, from inside and outside... You will hear flushing all hotels, not talking about the housekeepers in the morning, doors... anyway... my worst stay

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl808
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early Sept 2011 as a solo female (mid-40's) traveler. Location was pretty central. I was able to walk everywhere. Didn't take the public transport. I took a day tour to Toledo, which was very good. The breakfast and room it was served in was good. Always had yogurt, eggs, cured meats, cereal, good coffee, etc. The staff was polite and helpful. The bathroom was pretty large and modern for European standards. Body shower, rain shower and hand-held. Slate floors. I was in room 714 (I think), but I don't believe it was any different than any other room. Oh, and had a fridge in the room to store misc. pastries I had from the day. That was a plus. Italian restaurant around the corner was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mara19
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for the ones who want to explore Madrid. The best places, the best attractions of the city are close to the hotel. But not only the location makes the hotel a good choice, the personnel is smiling and they try to give you tips for your stay. It's not a luxury hotel, but it's a good value for money, still you have a terrace in case you want to enjoy a cigarette and feel the Spanish sun. The only bad thing is that they don't have a proper elevator to get to the reception which gives you pains in the back to drag the suitcase upstairs. All in all, it is a good hotel for an enjoyable stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: holmes2234
Reviews.Content: It is billed as a 4 star however it does not even measure up to a 2 star. It is dirty, smelly, with a dis respectable staff. It is not suitable for travelers who need a clean, welcoming, place to stay. we requested early check in, higher floor, and non smoking. We left rather then submit to their "extra charge to check in early" - sleeping in a room on the 2nd floor that was so small it would have been impossible for 2 adults live in it or take the only room available on the "smoking floor" or " pay 30 euros to have a room on a higher floor". We are currently disputing their charges because we canceled. We did not cancel - we refused to stay.

Reviews.Title: “would have being better off staying in a rubbish bin”
Reviews.Author: richardaholmes37
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this Hotel, the room we had was stinking of smoke,and was poorly lit .Even when all the lights were on during the day it still was very dark(maybe this was to disguise the dirt of the room and the damp patch on the ceiling).The hotel layout was the worst i have ever seen and lacked any atmosphere,the breakfast area was dated and uninviting and we decided to eat out even though breakfast was paid for .The only good thing i could say about this hotel was the location.On checking out i was served with an extremely overpriced mini bar bill and was charged for items we didn't even have,the staff were unhelpful and lacked enough english to deal with the mini bar problem, the list of items that were suppose to be in the fridge and the price of the items was not in the room for the duration of my stay, be warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: kiterunner67
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation at this hotel for 3 nights in march for spring break.. Location during the day was good. At night location was bad. Had to leave windows open in march since the rooms were smelling real bad and dark.No proper lights. If they had proper lights you would see all the cracks and patch -ups in the walls. When we left windows open, then the people singing and loud shouting would come in and it was so cold at night. . They did not have another room for us. The next day we went looking for another hotel with 2 kids and 7 pieces of luggage after i told them how bad our room was. There was no internet connection either . They still charged us for 3 nights although we were there only for 1 night. Talked to them many times after I got back to US but they will not refund the money for the 2 nights we were not there. We paid for the night we were there. The hotel does not look like in the photos shown here for the hotel. The lobby does not look like a lobby. Not at all a 4 star. So if you plan on having a relaxing stay in madrid ,DO NOT stay at this hotel. When you travel out of the country ,you hope to get what you think you are going to have. Not even a 2 star. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “great location; inpractical structure for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: adiscerningtrvlr
Reviews.Content: We chose the location for a short couple of days during the Christmas Holidays as we wanted to spend time shopping and relaxing in the center of Madrid. We found the hotel to be in a perfect location, just steps away from Corte Ingles and Puerta del Sol. The hotel's service is minimal; there is a long staircase from the very entrance of the hotel to reach the front desk area, and then another set of stairs to reach the lifts. The floor hallways seem like the hotel was awkardly designed and the hallways are dark and lack proper signage. The breakfast area has a buffet that lacked eye-appealing presentation. We ended up having breakfast just outside of the hotel at a cool little local place wher the bocatas were the best. The room is tight with furnitura that seems inexpensive and cluttered. To reach the bathroom inside our room we had to again take several steps to the next level. I would consider staying somewhere else on our next short trip to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - Computer Identity Theft and More!!!”
Reviews.Author: spinItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two nights ago and discovered today that somehow my personal email address database was accessed during my stay here, and spam email was sent to everyone on my database. This hotel markets itself as a "high-tech" hotel with laptop computers in each room. I used my in-room computer to access my emails. Sometime during my online time, my address book was hacked and accessed. To make matters worse, my mother who was staying in another room in the same hotel has had a Trojan horse virus attached to the personal emails that she sent from a different laptop from the same hotel. I cannot find away to access this hotel via email and the front-desk folks did not speak enough English for me to properly address this problem. Visitor beware...this has NEVER happened to me before having traveled extensively throughout Europe, and now I have to play repairman with every person in my email address book. Stay here if you must, but DO NOT use their computers!!!

Reviews.Title: “I have never felt that cold in Spain”
Reviews.Author: camille99
Reviews.Content: It is the second time I have stayed in this hotel. The first time, during spring 2009, I arrived in the evening and despite a reservation for a non-smoking room, they proposed me an awfully stinking room. After some discussion, I got a tiny spare room, without any daylight, but at least, it didn't smell. This time, I arrived even later in the eveing, as my plane was very late. I got a well sized room, that seemed not to have been used for some time. A light cover of dust was on the furniture and the room was not heated at all (outside temperature 5°C). I started the (noisy) Airco to heat the room. Due to the noise, I decided to stop it before going to bed. But during night, I had to turn it on again. The "cold" sitting in the bed and the walls, it was not possible to have a comfortable temperature. The day after, I turned the Airco to 24°C at around 6 in the evening and the room was finally acceptable when I returned after dinner at 11. As many other hotels, this one has also carpet floors which I don't like at all (impossible to keep them clean). Despite this rather negative experience, there are some positive points to report. The bathrooms are well equiped and have a large and comfortable shower. All rooms are equipped qith a laptop including free internet access. The hotel is well located, close to metro station "Sevilla". Breakfast is ok for the price you pay (12 EUR).

Reviews.Title: “excellent design”
Reviews.Author: romanasa
Reviews.Content: Room had computer, tv, massage shower Great location, has a place to hold luggage

Reviews.Title: “I seem to have come on holiday by mistake”
Reviews.Author: docframe
Reviews.Content: Shabby rooms, concrete outlook and indifferent service.... Moniker of "hitech hoteles" is seemingly represented by a 3 head multijet shower, a bolted on laptop to the desk and an "internet cafe" in the foyer ... shame it doesn't extend to providing two bedside lights, room for your partner or their luggage in a double room. Misconceived attempts at emulating boutique hotels with darkened corridors and dramatic lighting only served to highlight the dust on the proud numerals outside our room and engender a greater sense of misery. On a positive note, our appreciation of the Prado has been accentuated by the dramatic contrast and proximity of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped”
Reviews.Author: John10987
Reviews.Content: I arrived to be told that there was a problem with my booking - apparently my credit card didn't work when they tried to charge it (it worked everywhere else), they 'tried' to contact me (no evidence of this) and that they cancelled my booking (no warning - they had my phone number). So I didn't actually stay here - they said said they could put me in their sister hotel charging the same rate of 130 euro (ebven though the internet price of the new hotel was 89 euro) - the new hotel 'petit palace plaza del carmen' was uncomfortable, cramped, rubbish breakfast, had a view of a wall with incompetent staff. I would avoid this company (unless no other choice)...only real advantage is location...still though, not worth it

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: suzied
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-situated, not far from Puerto del Sol and right above the Sevilla subway station. It is a modern boutique hotel which offers in-room laptops with free internet access, so great for business. Notable also for the amazing view from the upstairs breakfast room which looks on to some beautiful roof-top sculptures.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaSantaMaria
Reviews.Content: The Sevilla Metro station is just around the corner. The Prado and train station are walkable in about 15-20 minutes. Starbuck's is across the street, and Gino's and VIP restaurants nearby are good. Alcala Torre service was good. Four of us stayed in a family room (with computer with free internet) for 3 nites.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but this is not a 4star”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotelbook.com and got a really good rate. the loaction of the hotels is fab but this "Hi-tech" hotel is probably only 3star material and service is somewhat limited. the room was dark and noisy, and the bed only had a single cover to the matress and then another single sheet over. Because this area of town is lively you need to be prepared for street noise throughout the night! The bathroom in my room looked great bit was more style over substance and the shower instantly flooded the whole bathroom floor. Breakfast (on 5ft floor) was generous but eggs looked as though they had sat their all night

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrrr100
Reviews.Content: I went w/ a group of friends and we booked a family room. It was one large bed and 2 bunk beds. It was a nice hotel. The room is small, but it's Europe and that was expected. I did not experience the problems written in other reviews. The internet was as fast as Comcast cable internet, the room clean, the shower nice. The water didn't splash out much from the shower even though it looked like it would. The location is excellent- right next to the Sevilla metro. The staff speaks some English, and one of them printed us out a map of where to go. There's a free beverage stand from noon to 22:00 w/ juice, coffee, and water. We didn't go to the restaurant in the hotel b/c we didn't come to Madrid to eat at the hotel restaurant. I don't have any complaints about the place. The hallways look cool and light up as you enter. Only thing is, I probably wouldnt come here as a family w/ kids b/c the top bunk doesn't have a rail, but it was no big deal for us (group of people in their later 20's). I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: GoshaMac
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location (metro station Sevilla is just on the corner, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Major and Gran Via are about 2-5 min by walk), but this its only main advantage. The property claims to be four stars, but I would except significantly more from such type of hotels. The rooms are tiny. The bathroom is located in the bedroom and is separated just by a glass curtain. Though I lived on the top floor, the view to the backyard was awful, no sun at all. Moreover, currently there are some noisy construction works. Check this with the hotel when you book it. The property provides laptop with free Internet access in every room which was nice and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Function self service hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich0148
Reviews.Content: It is a strange place, all very arty and looks nice at first, then you realise that it is like one of those Japanese hotels, ie, no real reception, bar area etc. Can only describe it as a self service hotel, with no character and also no way of sitting in the hotel bar and chatting with other guests. I would class it as a posh travel lodge. Four stars - no way!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don_Fluge
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasent stay in this hotel. The room wasn't the biggest but was very modern and pleasent. The highlight was the bathroom and in particular the shower which was very relaxing and therapeutic. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was quite central.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, but impersonal and indifferent”
Reviews.Author: Ricard G
Reviews.Content: This is a practical, functional hotel in a reasonable location. The rooms are a bit dark and gloomy, but spacious. The showers have been excellent on the two or three occasions I've used this hotel. Breakfast is OK, in quite a pleasant, bright room with the day's newspapers. However, the use of the expression "Hi Tech" in the hotel chain's name is misleading... There's nothing hi-tech about it. In fact, Internet access was, on one occasion I was there, impossible to obtain. They assured me there was a wireless network but I couldn't log on, and I couldn't get online using a network cable in the room either. Naturally there wasn't a technical person in the hotel available to help until the morning, and then that person didn't give me any advice I hadn't figured out for myself. I did manage to get online using a cable on subsequent visits, but the connection was excruciatingly slow, in fact pointless. Overall this hotel is just about OK, impersonal, indifferent and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “good but not four star”
Reviews.Author: Mimi001
Reviews.Content: While I enjoyed my stay at the Petit Palace Alcala Torre, I have to agree that it did not fit my expectations of a four star hotel. The rooms were clean and well decorated but were small and had a cost-cutting IKEA feel to them. Room service was also a bit lazy. Before booking I found several websites that indicated that the Petit Palace Alcala Torre had a swimming pool, so was disappointed to find that this is not true. They could have been old websites, however, as I cannot find them easily now. On the positive side, the Petit Palace is centrally located near two major subway stations (Sol and Banco de Espana). Also, the refreshment area was a nice touch, even though it was only available after noon. There are two laptop computers with internet access for guest use and a fax machine. Additionally, the front desk staff were helpful, friendly and efficient. Overall it was a pleasant stay but I don't think I'd book at this hotel again. For the money, I'd recommend going to a real four star.

Reviews.Title: “Its functional but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Thelostpearl
Reviews.Content: Very well located centrally in Madrid, this hotel is functional but I have no idea how it earnt four stars. It has contemporary styling which makes it appealing in a quirky way, The staff are less than welcoming at reception and when asked if we could have a non smoking room as I have asthma and was averaging three attacks a day, it was not possible but may be later within our stay. The breakfast is totally buffet and not staff and on every morning they had run out of bread rolls. It has stairs to negotiate with heavy luggage to get first to reception and then to the lifts! An ok stay just should be a 3 star. It was surprisingly quiet in our room but we did have a backward facing room which meant a dreadful view of buidling work but quiet enough to leave the windows open to attempt to remove the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but needs work”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March for a weekend break, rates were good and the hotel looked good from internet searches. When we arrived it was better than my expecatations from a location point of view-incredibly central to Place De Mayor and Place Del Sol and also the northern quarter of the city, its in the middle of the two main thoroughfares through Madrid. The hotel wasnt bad, nice rooms, as everyone says very modern but they seemed slightly unfinished-bits of skirting board missing or in our case tiles not fitted in the bathrooms. But for the money and the location it was great, it was clean and tidy and really not much to fault. The breakfast wasnt included but was 9 euros each and the food was good, nice breakfast room too. For our trip this was perfect as we spent most of our time out and about so it was a "base." Its a great place for this type of trip, the only real downside is the lack of facilities-no bar or evening restaurant but then you are in Madrid so plenty of great places to go! Would I stay here again-yes it did the job with no fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jordo3
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid with my girlfriend for 3 nights. We stayed at the Petit Palace Alcala Torre and enjoyed the relaxed comfortable atmosphere of this hotel. The rooms were modern, clean and were serviced well daily. The Shower was great (over head and side sprays) and the bed was very comfortable. We took the Metro from the Airport and arrived at Seville station which left us right outside the door of the hotel. The hotel is in a safe central place, surrounded by places to eat and within walking distance to all the major sites. The people behind reception were very helpful in advising us on what to see and how to get around the city. This hotel is ideal for a couple not looking for anything more than a comfortable, modern clean room with friendly staff. If I ever go back to Madrid for a short stay, I will be booking into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: jlo81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a last minute break with friends and thought it was great! I didn't go with any expectations as I had read the reviews on trip advisor, but the room was comfortable and clean with a flat screen tv and fresh bedding and towels every day. The location couldn't have been better, and the hotel has a contempory feel to it. I was here for 4 days and we all really enjoyed our stay, it is an excellent base to explore madrid from, and the staff were pretty helpful too, no complaints, although it can get noisy being on a main road so take your earplugs if you plan on having a lie-in!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend the Petit Palace Alcala Torre”
Reviews.Author: KarrieR
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace Alcala Torre is in a fantastic location and is a nice looking hotel too. The rooms were very modern, a bit too much so for some of the older people in our group, but everyone agreed that the bathrooms in most rooms were fab! Some rooms even had exercise bikes! Quirky or weird? We couldn't decide ;-) Also the breakfast was ok (we had it included in total cost of room so not sure how much it cost), really nice coffee. I can't recommend this hotel though. Most people in the group I was with had some serious complaint about their room, the main ones being: 1) excessive traffic noise and vibrations (all day and night) in the lower level rooms that are impossible to sleep to and 2) lack of water (hot or cold) in the higher level rooms. I had no water in my room for an entire day and had to wash my face and brush my teeth with bottled water from the mini bar (which they charged me for!). I couldn't even use the loo in my own room because it can't flush without water. Very annoying really. I never received an apology or even met with a sympathetic or understanding response to my complaint about no running water from the staff, no one in the group did to my knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, No Facilities”
Reviews.Author: mccrudden
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Madrid and intends to be out and about for the duration of their trip as the location is excellent and the rooms are perfectly decorated, fitted out and clean. It is not the kind of hotel to relax or chill out in as it there are no social areas and there are no hotel facilities such as bar, room service, in room tea/coffee or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with locking doors”
Reviews.Author: n0t.a.happy.bunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel because they offered high-tech rooms with Internet and nice looking bathrooms. All fine with that, it was easy to connect the laptop and the shower with massager was great. Central location made it easy to move around. We had an unpleasant encounter, though, at 3am the door was opened by someone, even though we had locked it from inside! So check the door when you leave and when you are in it. In the morning when we complained the staff was not very helpful, and the manager nor the hotel customer service never replied to emails.

Reviews.Title: “Still building it!!”
Reviews.Author: stevedjuk
Reviews.Content: Why would you want to stay in an Hotel that is still being built?When its finished it may be a nice place,but at the moment you can only stay in the noisy lower 2 floors,the ones above are being renovated.Once we got used to the very noisy rush-hour traffic we wore woken again by hammers and drills from the rooms above!!Unbelievable.We were given twin beds instead of a double,and had a power-cut one day too.The rooms are very small.Very disappointed with Last Minute.com who recommended this place!!Its in a good location,but then so is the pavement outside!!!

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: econ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite close to Peurta del Sol and Gran Via so was in a good location. The sightseeing bus also stopped quite close to the hotel. However, the hotel was disappointing. The photo of the outside of the hotel is very misleading - you would miss the main door of the hotel if you weren't looking carefully! We booked two double rooms for our party of four - one was considerably bigger than the other. The air conditioning in one room didn't work and when we complained to reception about it, they just ignored us. We complained each day and there was never a follow up by staff - the air con was never fixed, and there wasn't even an apology. Also, the hotel was on a main road and the street noise was very loud. It was very difficult to sleep with noise from cars and beeping of horns that started at about 7:00 each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not for kids”
Reviews.Author: Pastel
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the earlier reviews, in general, but found this hotel a poor choice for families with school age children, like us. There are several design flaws which made staying here unecessarily difficult. As you enter, the desk reception is up a flight of stairs, while the elevator for luggage is on the ground floor just to the right.. You pass it as you walk upstairs to the reception desk. This means one is separated from one's luggage in the first few seconds, before one has a chance to check in. Nothing came of this, but it is an uncomfortable beginning. We stayed on the 9th floor which has a view of the sidestreet below, and of buildings across the street. This was as expected. The first problem came with the sleeping arrangements. Bunk beds were set up for the children, but the top bunk had no siderail.. Also, the entire bunk set is end on to the windows. The ladder to the upper bunk also detaches easily, becoming a weapon in the hands of small boys. We wound up putting the mattress on the ground for sleeping purposes, and putting the ladder out of harm's way. Another problem was with the bathroom. The bathroom has an elaborate and unlabelled shower fixture with 4 knobs and, if you can imagine, parrallel rows of vertical spouts aimed directly at you as well. One cannot turn on the shower without standing inside it, and therefore gettting wet. The getting wet part is guarenteed by the parent's attempts to identify which knob is doing what while water is spraying the back wall and flooding the bathroom floor. To ensure flooding, the shower is protected by only half a glass wall, with the rest being wide open. Our kids loved the shower as it comes close to becoming a water slide if turned on full blast. The shower floor itself is slick as butter when wet, and there are no handles with which to steady oneself. My son solved this problem by lying on the shower floor and sloshing back and forth with ease. Naturally we ran out of toilet paper in the early morning, since supplies are more appropriate for 2 adults, The upsides are, as has been said, the closeness to the Seville stop on the Metro, and the good internet service. The hotel is clean and secure, and probably would be fine for independant young adults with good balance and handeye coordination. Pastel

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought they were very friendly at the reception. "If there is anything you need to know call reception and I will be here to help you". The elevator going upstairs in the tower is quite small, but they probably wanted to use the space more efficiently. It is always an exciting moment when you open the door of your hotelroom. But it was a pleasant surprise. Enough space for the two of us for a stay of three nights. The beds slept very well and we were very happy with the laptop with (free) 24/7 use of the internet. Ideal for looking up information about the city, play a little music or check the weather for example. The bathroom was nice as well. Clean, a very nice (spacious) shower and design. The airconditioning worked well and was quiet. We had a nice view and weren't troubled by noise from outside. Last but not least: the location was perfect! You feel safe in the neighbourhood and you can walk everything. Summed up: we we very pleased with this place as our 'home' for a couple of days in beautiful Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! great hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterlgged
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights after being moved from one of the nearby high tech properties (something about a water issue) in Madrid. The room was fantastic. A 20" LCD flat panel TV, plenty of space, fantastic bathroom, and clean! We had a family room as we had reserved for 3 people. Two of the beds were pushed together to form a quasi-king and the other two were bunks which folded up against the wall. even with them down the room was plenty big for the three of us. we also received complimentary beverages (not sure if this was due to our shifting hotels). the bathroom was great, i've never had such a fantastic shower in my life. overall a great experience and not overly expensive for the wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: Hercval
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Alcala Torre for 3 nights in February. The hotel is centrally located (closest tube station Sevilla while Puerta del Sol is only 3-4 minutes away). It opened mid-January 2006 without having been completed. As a result there was still work in progress while we were there! The room we were given at first was so small that we did not have enough space to take pictures of it! The room was not much bigger than the bed. The bed was 20cm away from the window on one side and 20cm from the closet on the other side! We asked for a bigger one;We were given a slightly bigger room but there was still no space to put our luggage! The bathroom was the room's biggest asset. Big, modern and clean! The breakfast is served on the 5th floor and there is a lot of light and nice views... if only there were not all these flies and just one waiter, it would have been great! All in all I would say that if you are after a hotel centrally located, you do not suffer from claustrophobia, you have no problem with flies and you do not want to spend much... go for it!!!
